brief_summary.textblock:
This is a randomized controlled trial comparing extracorporeal shockwave lithotripsy (ESWL)
      with and without simultaneous adjunct controlled inversion therapy in the treatment of lower
      pole caliceal stone.

clinical_study.brief_title: Adjunct Inversion for Lower Pole Stone

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. Solitary lower pole caliceal stone which is > 5 mm and  < 20mm

          2. Not contraindicated for intravenous urogram (IVU) and subsequent X-rays

          3. Patient able to comply strictly with visits/medications

          4. Patient willing and agrees to enter study

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Impaired function of  the affected kidney

          2. Gross hydronephrosis of the affected kidney

          3. Associated distal obstruction

          4. Multiple stones

          5. Stone more than 2 cm in size

          6. Diverticular stone

          7. Patients who are contraindicated for extracorporeal shockwave lithotripsy  e.g.:
             Pregnancy

          8. Patients who are unable to tolerate the procedure

          9. Significant cardiac condition that does not allow the administration of force
             hydration or inversion.

         10. Uncontrolled hypertension

intervention.description: Patients inverted 30 degree head down in Trendelenburg position
Hydration of patient with 0.5L NaCl and 20mg frusemide IV

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Randomized, Double Blind, Controlled Study Comparing Extracorporeal Shock Wave Lithotripsy (ESWL) With and Without Simultaneous Adjunct Controlled Inversion Therapy in the Treatment of Lower Pole Caliceal Stone

primary_outcome.description: To compare the effectiveness of simultaneous adjunct controlled inversion therapy during extracorporeal shockwave lithotripsy (ESWL) to that of ESWL alone in the treatment of lower pole caliceal stone as measured by stone-free rate(SFR)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
